item.title: Black Mesa doesn't appear in the steam library
item.dc:creator: Mondragora
item.description:
Katana:

Steam looks for a gameinfo.txt file in Steam/steamapps/sourcemods/modnamehere/gameinfo.txt. That’s what it uses to add it to the steam list of games. Also for the record, the Black Mesa folder needs to be named ‘bms’.
If Steam isn’t detecting it at all, that may actually be an issue with Steam, rather than the game. Just having a properly-formatted gameinfo.txt in that folder should cause something to be listed.

OK, I have the same problem discussed here. And I do have a file named Steam/steamapps/sourcemods/BMS/gameinfo.txt. But it is not on my list of games in Steam. I have restarted Steam many times, restarted my system…don’t know what else to do.

I did notice that the actual hl2 exe file is located in Steam/steamapps/myusername/source sdk base 2007 – is that right?

I used the default download paths, so I don’t see why any of it would be wrong.
